comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: Flying above this city is an early Breguet Biplane Type 1910. Interesting feature of this machine are the small rudders between the wings on left and right. The caption is false, the name of the flyer Beregi is surely the name of Louis Breguet misspelled. The famous designer was early in hs career also a great flyer. The city that is overflown by Louis Breguet looks distinctly Arabic. Maybe a town in Marocco Cheers Kees [aka Varese2002]

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks for this information. We'll add it to the source catalog.

comment.author: 87436182@N00
comment._content: Indeed, it's a Moroccan city, and I'm pretty sure it's the city of Fez with it's distinctive surrounding landscape.
